intro: Seriola brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian amberjack, is a marine fish belonging to the family Serranidae. It is native to the coastal waters of South America, particularly in the Atlantic Ocean off Brazil. The plant aspect refers to its habitat and ecological role within aquatic environments. It thrives in temperate to subtropical waters and is often found near rocky shores or coral reefs. This species plays a vital role in marine ecosystems as both a predator and a prey species.
